item.title: Report X-2024050872
item.description:
Report X-2024050872

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-29T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was discovered wet and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. All 4 plastic bottles of Noble Power Liquid Machine detergent leaked from loose caps. About 20 ounces were released. The caps were not secured. No padding was used. Only slotted partitions were used. The shipper should have used sufficient inner packaging materials and should have secured the caps to avoid spills.

  • Description: Corrosive hazmat package was found wet & torn. Upon inspection found 2 bottles of Diversey Suma Nova mechanical dish detergent 1-gallon had defective lids resulted to leakage. Lids were secured but liquid content still leaked out. Package was a unprocessed hazmat.

item.title: Report E-2024050568
item.description:
Report E-2024050568

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-27T21:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: DORAL
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS AIR CARGO FACILITY IN MIAMI, FLORIDA, CARGO ON A WOODEN SKID WAS BEING INSPECTED FOR AIR MOVEMENT TO GUATEMALA. INSPECTION OF ONE WHITE COURIER BAG ON THE WOODEN SKID REVEALED ONE BOX CONCEALED IN THE BAG WITH A GROUND LTD QTY MARKING. THE BOX ALSO HAD A COVERED UN3480/UN3481 LITHIUM BATTERY MARK. OPEN BOX INSPECTION REVEALED THREE LITHIUM ION BATTERY POWERED REMOTE CONTROL TRUCKS. THERE ARE FOUR LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED WITH THE REMOTE CONTROL TOY TRUCKS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS VISIBLE ON THE OUTER WHITE COURIER BAG OR SHOWN ON THE AIR WAYBILL.

item.title: Report E-2024050463
item.description:
Report E-2024050463

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics – NJV experienced a UN1789 Muriatic Acid release from a 5-gallon poly jug. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1.5-gallons of product released to a 15’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. Absorbents were deployed to clean the impacted area. All impacted absorbents, the damaged jug, and PPE were containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024051167
item.description:
Report X-2024051167

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-23T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner contents: 4 cans of Aerospace Coatings part# CM0483660 and CM0560563. 2 cans leaked. SDS online confirmed undeclared dg. All contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.
